评论概述: Pretty decent with a few imperfections
评论详情: Pros: -Comfy -Seemingly Durable so far -Lots of pockets -Cell phone pocket -nice dark black color -light weight fabric  Cons: -Cell phone pocket is misaligned and needs to be longer, even without a phone it only grabs maybe 1/3 of the velcro to seal. With a phone it barely even grabs any. -knee pad pockets are super long and sit a bit low. They seem more like shin guards than knee pad pockets because you barely get any protection unless you shift them all the way up. Maybe it can be fixed with longer pads but I didn't see any info about them nor do they include them despite the high price tag. -pricey but -velcro read pocket is on the left instead of on the right. In my exp most people put their wallet on the right side, but this is on the opposite end.

评论概述: Far better than the Cat pants.
评论详情: I bought a house that needs a full restoration and one of the many things I've bought in that effort are several pairs of work pants. I bought the Cat pants the same day I bought the Dewalt Protradesman work pants and there's no comparison. The Dewalt pants are superior in every way even though the Cat pants cost $70 and the Dewalt pants $50. The Cat's are sized small, the sewing in the crotch failed after three uses, the Velcro closures on the pockets began peeling off and stopped adhering after two washes and the various pockets aren't very utilitarian. The Protradesman pants fit as expected, have well thought-out and useful pockets and accessories and are stitched up like Fort Knox. I've had to repair the crotch and replace the Velcro on the Cat pants and don't even wear them anymore since I've become familiar with and now rely upon the usefulness of the pockets on the Protradesman pants. The Cat's aren't worth half the price and the Protradesman's are worth at least 30% more than the $50 I paid.

These pants are perfect for working in construction. There are a lot of pockets and the fit is perfect. They are comfortable but rugged enough to withstand construction work. Well made and high quality.
Lots of pockets and very comfortable to working
Comfortable, feel great and holds all my tools while working.

评论概述: Dewalt pro tradesman knee pad pant
评论详情: These are the best budget pants I have found for the Summer. Light material that has not ripped out after 2 months in basements,  crawl spaces and attics. I am a plumber so having something that breaths and has knee pad pockets is essential too me. The pocket are a bonus. I keep a marker, knife, and a close cutter in them all the time.  They may rip out by the end of summer, but so far no evidence that the material is going to. The velcro around the knee pad pants is even still holding. I cant justify high price pants because the stuff that ends up on them limits them to one season realistically anyways. In the Winter I shift to the CAT pants and this seems to be the best combination for me.
My son likes these pants so I got him a pair for a gift. He has a couple pairs already for work and they seem to hold up. I will be buying more.

评论概述: Great for work, comfy for lounging
评论详情: These are great work pants, it’s nice you can tuck the tool bags into the pockets when you don’t need them. Compared to the price of similar products these are definitely the winner in every department. Cost, quality, comfort and convenience!
Pay the money, IT is worth it. Plenty of pockets, sturdy, stylish, tough.

Disclaimer: I bought mine elsewhere, before Amazon carried them.  So overall, these are nice pants. I have 2 pair, that I bought in late 2019, and am now finally at the point of needing replacements. The overall fit is great, the utility is wonderful, and they're very comfortable to wear.  Now for the bad, and why these are o ly good, but not great. 1) the amount of distance from the top of the waistband to the cross-seam (where your perineum is) needs to be at least 1.5 to 2 inches longer, for the front half. The back half fits great, but the front is way too snug, which puts a lot of stress on that cross seam area, which is NOT reinforced at all, and it most certainly will be the first part to start failing - and I've yet to figure out a long-term solution to extend the life of it either. 2) The stitching for the belt loops is absurdly questionable, and doesn't take long to fail. This, of course, wouldn't even be an issue, were issue 1 non-existent, as that is what causes the stress on the loop stitching. 3) the knee pads are placed a good 2-3 inches too low, so if you need to squat or sit, you have to pull the pant legs up first, or the pads will pull the pants downward as you move into that position. Idk what person would wear these and NOT frequently be in such a situation, so this flaw is just inexcusable.  As I said, they're good, but not great. If Dewalt would fix these big flaws, these would be the most perfect on the market. I wear mine quite often, as they've been my workday pants since I bought them, and I've a full time job, so perhaps I've gotten my money out of them, but it's just ridiculous that I have to replace them already because of something so ridiculous as the groin section being of poor design and quality.
That half inch makes a difference. Also consider getting rid of the Velcro for the pockets. Velcro does not last, and it is more problematic than no flaps.
I think that they will last a lifetime.  They are a little bulkier than I expected.
